channel.title: lunar – Solar Anamnesis
channel.description: Scenes from the Solar System's Youth

item.title: NWA 10203 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: This thin section of NWA 10203 shows a wide range of fascinating features. As described on the Meteoritical Bulletin, this lunar breccia contains four lithologies: 1. Unbrecciated olivine gabbro with zoned clinopyroxene. 2. Fragmental anorthositic gabbro breccia. 3. Fragmental gabbroic breccia with approximately equal proportions of plagioclase, pyroxene and olivine. 4. Shock melt veins and […]

item.title: NWA 8010 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: NWA 8010 has many fascinating melt veins which reflect its unique historical formation. Viewed in cross polarized light this meteorite thin section is a wonderful sample of the Moon. Additional References: Crystalline Lunar Spherules Northwest Africa 8010 View Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View with krpano Purchase Prints: Visit Store

item.title: NWA 032 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: The scientifically important Northwest Africa 032 basalt meteorite contains olivine and pyroxene phenocrysts, which can be clearly seen in this thin section mosaic. Being one of the youngest basalt rocks from the Moon, it provides clues regarding the formation of the Lunar Mare. Northwest Africa 032 and 479 Pairing Details at Meteorite Studies View Meteorite […]

item.title: NWA 4734 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: NWA 4734 is a unique lunar mare basalt. Thin section displayed here is in cross polarized light. Addition information: Northwest Africa 4734 & 10597 Northwest Africa 4734 PDF Paper Meteorite Studies NWA 4734 View Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View with krpano Purchase Prints Visit Store

item.title: NWA 2977 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: A fascinating polarized thin section specimen of NWA 2977. This meteorite, classed as a Lunar Gabbro, provides researchers a rare sample of the ancient lunar basalt while providing aesthetes a beautiful look at lunar history. Additional resources: Meteorite Thin Section Gallery Meteorite Studies View Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View with krpano […]
